https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#Identifier mentions that Identifer is:

A numeric or alphanumeric string that is associated with a single object or entity within a given system

From that description it sounds like that anything that isn't numeric or alphanumeric is allowed. That is hower not the case as the use of eg. '-' and ':' are allowed in both system and value - so shouldn't that description either be updated or should the conformance rules be made stricter? @Grahame Grieve
you've picked just about the only text that still remains from old V3 data types
it could certainly be clearer. It doesn't just have to alpha-numerics, though that's usually what it is
you'll never guess the question I just had then ;)
do you need a JIRA or can you modify the parts directly
I'll expect a medal and a finders fee next time we meet :D
I'll give you one consistent with the magnitude of your discovery
